title: When you hear the word love, what comes to mind and why? - Quora

response.answer_text: My friend once told me that love is when you like someone over a year without having to see them. Three years ago when I was still in Belgium(two months before returning to Japan), I decided to talk to the people in my class whom I never had talked to. Amongst those people, there was one guy who I did not like. He was violent, arrogant, and loud. Not my type. I was scared of him and physically unable to befriend him. (Like once when he walked towards me in the hall, my body instinctively took a boxing defense pose) However, I made my decision. So I started to talk to him. Gradually, I became used to his presence. I also noticed his inner kindness. He wasn't the jerk I thought he would be. Yes, he was violent and would hit girls(Literal meaning), but he never actually hurt anyone. He was just being playful, and oddly enough, he was pretty popular among the girls. My feelings started changing. I had never thought he was attractive, but now I did. I had never thought I would be writing notes to him during class, but now I did. I had never thought I would be so excited to go to school, but now I did. I had never thought I would feel so happy because of someone, and now I did. I was in love. By the time I had to leave Belgium, I was madly in love. I didn’t now how I could survive without being able to see him. I wrote him a letter a week before leaving. I never expected him to reply but he did. He handed me a letter on my last day at school. I still have it, locked safely in my treasure box. Even after I came back to japan, my feelings never changed. I had to tell myself that I would be able to meet him someday in order to keep me going. I felt a sadness I had never felt before. I read his letter over and over, every day to keep myself going.This went on for about two years. As of now, I don’t feel that necessity to meet him, but if I ever meet him again, I know that the burning sensation I used to feel for him will come back. To me, Love is many things. Love is happiness, sadness, trust, unpredictable, and eternal. p.s. Sorry for the long answer hehe.

On Love, from The Prophet, by Khahil Gibran: When love beckons to you, follow him, Though his ways are hard and steep. And when his wings enfold you yield to him, Though the sword hidden among his pinions may wound you. And when he speaks to you believe in him, Though his voice may shatter your dreams as the north wind lays waste the garden.For even as love crowns you so shall he crucify you. Even as he is for your growth so is he for your pruning. Like sheaves of corn he gathers you unto himself. He threshes you to make you naked. He sifts you to free you from your husks. He grinds you to whiteness. He kneads you until you are pliant; And then he assigns you to his sacred fire, that you may become sacred bread for God's sacred feast. All these things shall love do unto you that you may know the secrets of your heart, and in that knowledge become a fragment of Life's heart. But if in your fear you would seek only love's peace and love's pleasure, Then it is better for you that you cover your nakedness and pass out of love's threshing floor,Into the seasonless world where you shall laugh, but not all of your laughter, and weep, but not all of your tears. Love gives naught but itself and takes naught but from itself, Love possesses not nor would it be possessed: For love is sufficient unto love. When you love you should not say, "God is in my heart," but rather, "I am in the heart of God." And think not you can direct the course of love, for love, if it finds you worthy, directs your course. Love has no other desire but to fulfill itself. But if you love and must needs have desires, let these be your desires: To melt and be like a running brook that sings its melody to the night. To know the pain of too much tenderness. To be wounded by your own understanding of love; And to bleed willingly and joyfully. To wake at dawn with a winged heart and give thanks for another day of loving; To rest at the noon hour and meditate love's ecstasy; to return home at eventide with gratitude; And then to sleep with a prayer for the beloved in your heart and a song of praise upon your lips.

That's a question that requires a lot of thought. Love is a verb, an action. Not a feeling. Joy is the feeling just as often as fear, or anger, or caring, or greif. If I had a wife and she told me that she was so sick she wasn't going to work, I could say “alright dear I'll call ya'”. And unless I sensed that she just needed a day off from it all, I'm not slgiving her my love. Love would be me saying whatever and leaving. Coming fight back in and saying “ Just kidding” and then calling my boss and chewing him out 'cause I'm not going to work. Again I'd be playing, because I already called work off when she wasn't looking. Now I can pamper her and let her get rest while I do yard work or fix the car. Cleaning the house is a definite. And that is love. So what do I think when I hear the word, LOVE? I think of LIFE , and what I've been through. Because good or bad, we all been youched by LOVE. Get you some if you can.

Love!❤️ It had different meanings at different ages and phases of life i think! school  someone sharing their luch box with yousomeone taking the blame for making nussiance in class on your behalf.someone allowing you to copy from their project or assignment.someone calling you post school to enquire as to why you didn't come to school and about and giving you updates on what was taught and home work as well.College  Proxy on your behalf 😉Ordering your favourite food at canteenHelping you find proper professors for submissionsHelping you in group assignment and last minute assignment completion.office  Keeping you informed as to your manager has arrived or not .Helping you with things you are working on for the first time.Home  Arguing from your side against your parents (siblings love). Thank you for reading. If you like my writing do upvote as it has better reach due to algorithm. 🙌☺️ Images Credit - Google

When i hear the word “love”, sadly enough, i think about the misconceptions of the word. Many people, at least in my experience, think that if you love someone, you might want a relationship or sex. If you ask me this is not true; you can love a friend for who they are, that does not mean you want to marry them. For example, sat there was a boy. He has a girlfriend, and a girl best friend. One day while with hos girlfriend, he receives a text from his girl best friend, pulls out his phone, and replies with a heart, or says i love you. The girlfriend instantly assumes he is cheating or wants a relationship with the girl best friend. In reality he does not, he just loves who she is as a person. I think i have an uncommon thought when i hear the word love, and an even more uncommon opinion of love, but that’s just who i am.

There are so many facets to the word love. It would be hard to define one, and there are so many kinds of love. I will say this though however it manifests in your life, it's something to be treasured. You need to know the difference between love and obsession. You also need to know when it's toxic either giving or receiving and pull back so that it doesn't destroy you or the person you care about. I'm not saying don't put yourself out there because that's how you find love. I'm saying take it slow.

There in the ocean of you my nights never end as the whisper of the seas call me home. Cast in the air I watch your beautiful form face the evening to sky as the lines shift darker in the near reveal of a heart that is yours. With my hands I see you smile a miss. It is because you know the fragrance of real is there looking to be with you. For now the dimming night’s brim bring him to you again. The mist is where he placed his heart to be. Passing the night he breathes you deep …. So deep it cradles in the smile he wears to share your life. Listen to what you hear, the in and out waves are only but a shallowed breath. It is your love that was pure. You have an excellence to wear as I take your hands… There in the ocean of you my nights never end as the whisper of the seas call me home.

1 Though I speak with the tongues of men and of angels, but have not love I am only a resounding gong or clanging cymbal. 2 And though I have the gift of prophecy, and can understand all mysteries and all knowledge, and though I have faith, that can move mountains, but have not love, I am nothing. 3 And though I give all I possess to the poor, and surrender my body to the flames, but have not love, I gain nothing. 4 Love suffers long and is kind; love does not envy; love does not parade itself, is not puffed up; 5 does not behave rudely, does not seek its own, is not provoked, thinks no evil; 6 does not rejoice in iniquity, but rejoices in the truth; 7 bears all things, believes all things, hopes all things, endures all things. 8 Love never fails. But whether there are prophecies, they will fail; whether there are tongues, they will cease; whether there is knowledge, it will vanish away. 9 For we know in part and we prophesy in part. 10 But when that which is perfect has come, then that which is in part will be done away. 11 When I was a child, I spoke as a child, I understood as a child, I thought as a child; but when I became a man, I put away childish things. 12 For now we see in a mirror, darkly, but then face to face. Now I know in part, but then I shall know just as I also am known. 13 And now abide faith, hope, love, these three; but the greatest of these is love.  St. Paul, Rembrandt  Epistles of Paul in the New King James Version 1 Corinthians 13 - Wikipedia  ,,,,,,,,,,,

That depends on the context. When I’m reading a good book and someone tells their lover: “I love you”, I kind of suspected it but I’m still thinking: “Holy crap! They said it!” When someone says that they “love” something, well I just think they like it or find it mighty convenient. The word is quite overused after all. And in the movies and in real life, I don’t really hear anyone other than children telling their parents that they love them. Usually, couples publicly convey the word “love” in a more intimate manner. I just look away.

I think about my ex gf. Before I met her, I was just a boy who is unconsciously bounded by shame. It was my family who did that to me. And I did not know how to love, others, as well as myself. For me, the definition of love was unusually distorted. Then she came and healed part of my wound. I started to love myself more, even I not realizing it at that time. But again, the devil revealed itself. I pushed her away and she ripped out my scar. She's gone. I went back to my own distorted lonely world. Until now I think Love is still not in my dictionary, in case you ask me about the ‘pure love'. But the distorted one, difinitely I think about her.

Love is care, understanding each other thoughts, friendship, emotional attachment, respect, loyality , express your precious words for each other, understand each other strengths and weaknesses , motivate each other in bad time, stand for each other in bad time, live peacefully and enjoy every moment of life.
My wife

It’s a tennis score. The start of the summer school holiday used to coincide with Wimbledon and so hearing “Forty love. Quiet please” on the TV or radio meant no more homework for a few weeks. It’s that feeling of bliss when a baby falls asleep on your shoulder  It’s the joy of seeing the youngest and oldest members of your family together. It’s feeling one with nature.  It’s oxytocin.

A heart that has been through a lot but is fixed. The heart is something that can be broken easily, but with a little help, it can be healed like a band aid put on a wound. If you give it time that little scar or wound can be healed. But if a scar, then its going to leave residue and stay permanently. But there isn't no more pain. It is just a mark.

LOVE is what formed us in the womb from the beginning. From acts of passion and pains in many ways can be translated into love, even if certain displays of affection be unhealthy for us to experience has still been given in love.

Warmth. Lifeforce. The Universe. Humans. Bernese mountain dog puppies. Tuxedo kittens. Someone smiling on top of a hill and taking a deep breath enjoying the view. Singing. Dancing. Flying. Laughing. Hugs.

I want to stop being invisible for once, and be visible. They always say a special someone will love you for who you are. Love is like the WAVES: comes and go, but once it stays then it defiantly is your true love. -porkchop_faith

Thanks for A2A Zaina. Love is a beautiful feeling when: someone cares for you. someone likes you for how you are and does’nt try to change you. someone respects you. someone misses you when you are not around. someone likes your company .

Love is PEACELove is KINDNESSLove is MERCYLove is GENTLENESSLove is SELF CONTROLLove is COMPASSIONLove is WISDOMLove is FORGIVINGLove is TRUEFUL & LOYALTYLove is FAITHFULLove is being PATIENCE with life.Love is willing TO SHARE EXTRAS of everything with the poor.Love is YOU & ME & HIM & HER & IT IS I AM one in heart in mind ….
Its bound to happen at any given time.
I think of my wife and son.
My son.
